thread.title: Gmail will push users further away for XP and Vista
thread.title_full: Gmail will push users further away for XP and Vista

author: pcworld.com
title: Gmail will push users further away for XP and Vista
text:
Google quietly announced Tuesday that Gmail will stop supporting older versions of its Chrome browser soon, in a move that will put another nail in the coffins of Windows XP and Windows Vista.
Users of Chrome version 53 and older editions of the browser could start being redirected to the basic HTML version of Gmail as early as December, the company said in a blog post. Starting next week, users who will be affected by the change will start seeing a banner at the top of Gmail telling them to upgrade to an up-to-date version of Googleâ€™s browser.
The affected browser versions include Chrome v49, the last version of the software that supports XP and Vista. While Microsoft officially ended support for XP more than two and a half years ago , Gmail has continued to work with it. Vista Service Pack 2 will reach the end of its extended support period on April 11.
